data.title: Pierce A. Paul
data.text:
Profile Tabs

Profile

Pierce A. Paul

Chair and Professor. Cereal Pathology, Epidemiology

(330) 263-3842

Office:

115 Selby Hall, Wooster

Professional Information

Degrees & Credentials:

PhD Plant Pathology, Iowa State University

MS Plant Pathology, Universidade Federal de Vicosa, Brazil

BS Agronomy, Universidade Federal de Vicosa, Brazil

Diploma, Agriculture Science, Guyana School of Agriculture, Guyana

Extension Specialization(s):

Cereal crops, integrated disease management (emphasis on wheat, corn, barley)

Biography:

(View publications under the "Works" tab)

My general interest is epidemiology and integrated management of plant diseases, with emphasis on understanding the basic biology and ecology of plant pathogens and the use of this information to develop disease management tools for practical application. I am particularly interested in the use of statistical and computer models to describe plant disease dynamics in the field and the use of these models to make disease management decisions based on risk assessment and disease prediction.

An understanding of the basic biology and ecology of plant pathogens is indispensable for effective disease management through disease prediction and risk assessment. Basic research has to be an ongoing process if we are to understand the effects of changing weather patterns, shifts in pathogen populations, genetic manipulation of crops, and changes in cropping practices on the appearance of new and resurgence of existing plant diseases.

I use statistical and computer models to describe the effects and anticipate possible consequences of these changes on disease development and crop yield. I would like to take advantage of modern statistical techniques, sophisticated computer technology, large weather database, and fast and efficient information delivery systems to development and use prediction and risk assessment models as decision-making tools in integrated disease management programs.

> Lab website

Honors and Awards

2016 - Syngenta Award (outstanding recent contributions to plant pathology) > American Phytopathological Society

2016 - Distinguished Junior Faculty Research Award > Ohio Agricultural Research and Development Center

2008 - William Boright Hewitt and Maybelle Ellen Ball Hewitt Award (outstanding contributions towards plant disease control within 7 years of the PhD) > American Phytopathological Society

Teaching

I co-teach Diseases of Field Crops (PLNTPTH 5140) with Anne Dorrance, offered Autumn semesters.

Extension

Podcast Demonstrates How to Identify Wheat Growth Stages

Videos help wheat growers identify various stages of wheat growth and to know what management strategies can be used during each growth stage:

> Feekes Growth Stage 6

> Feekes Growth Stages 7 & 8

> Feekes Growht Stages 9 & 10

> Wheat Flowering Stage

Narrated presentation on Fusarium Head Blight (head scab) and how to measure head scab in the field by Pierce Paul and Dennis Mills > View presentation

Katelyn T. Willyerd, Pierce A. Paul, Peter Thomison and Dennis Mills were awarded a Certificate of Excellence in the Agronomy Society of America Educational Materials Awards Program for the OSU Extension fact sheet:

Gibberella Ear Rot and Mytotoxins in Corn: Sampling, Testing and Storage

< View pdf on Ohioline

View highlight piece featuring the Fusarium head blight risk assessment tool (pdf)

Professional Experience

Associate Professor, The Ohio State University, Plant Pathology, 2012 - present

Assistant Professor, The Ohio State University, Plant Pathology, 2006 - 2011

Research Scientist and Extension Specialist, The Ohio State University, Plant Pathology, 2005-2006

Postdoctoral Researcher, The Ohio State University, Plant Pathology, 2003-2005

Graduate Teaching Assistant, Iowa State University, College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, Department of Plant Pathology. Ames, Iowa, 2002

Phytosanitary Inspector, Iowa State University, College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, Department of Plant Pathology and Iowa Department of Agriculture. Ames, Iowa, 2000

Graduate Research Assistant, Iowa State University, College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, Department of Plant Pathology, Plant Pathology. Ames, Iowa, 1999 - 2003

Graduate Teaching Assistant, Universidade Federal de Vicosa, Cincias Agrrias, Departamento de Fitopathologia. Vicosa, Brazil, 1999

Graduate Research Assistant, Universidade Federal de Vicosa, Cincias Agrrias, Departamento de Fitopathologia. Vicosa, Brazil, 1997 - 1999

Undergraduate Research Assistant, Universidade Federal de Vicosa, Cincias Agrrias, Departamento de Fitopathologia. Vicosa, Brazil, 1995 - 1997
